hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Musa al-Ash'ari: Allah will spread His wing over the believers on the Day of Judgment like this (and he indicated with his hand above him), and will say: 'O son of Adam, this is a good deed you did in such and such place at such and such time, and I have accepted it from you.' Then the believer will prostrate. Then He will say: 'O son of Adam, this is an evil deed you committed on such and such day, and I have forgiven you for it.' Then the believer will prostrate. The creation will say: 'Blessed is this slave - in his record is seen nothing but good deeds because of how much he prostrates.' Then when it is finished, he will say: 'Read your book, I thought I would meet my account,' - meaning he will say: 'I now know (for certain)'.

Jabir said: I heard the Prophet ﷺ say: I stayed in seclusion in Hira. When I finished my seclusion, I came down in the valley. hadiths.english_translation: A man from Banu Tamim said: We were with Abu al-Awwam when he recited this verse: 'Upon it are nineteen' (Surah al-Muddaththir 74:30). He asked: What do you say - is it nineteen angels or nineteen thousand angels? I said: Rather nineteen thousand. He asked: How do you know that? I said: Because Allah the Mighty and Majestic said: 'And We have not made their number except as a trial for those who disbelieve' (Surah al-Muddaththir 74:31). Abu al-Awwam said: You are right.
